newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Peru's Fujimori arrives in Bangladesh.
newsitem.headline: Peru's Fujimori arrives in Bangladesh.

text.p: Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori on Saturday arrived in Bangladesh to a warm welcome from his hosts but noisy protests by left-wing political and student groups.
Bangladesh President Shahabuddin Ahmed and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina received Fujimori at Dhaka airport as military guards fired a traditional salute.
As Fujimori drove into the capital city in a motorcade, left-wing students demonstrated outside Dhaka University.
"Go back Fujimori, you are not welcome here," chanted the students as riot police struggled to keep them from the streets, witnesses said.
Several political groups demonstrated in Dhaka on Friday against Fujimori's visit and vowed more protests during his stay.

"We denounce the visit of Peru's hated President Fujimori who has dealt inhumanely with anti-fascist revolutionaries, including communist leader Abimael Guzman," said a leader of the Democratic Revolutionary Council during Friday's protest.
Guzman, leader of Peru's Maoist Shining Path rebels, was captured in 1992, which his followers called a severe blow to human rights and principles of freedom.
Dhaka protesters called Fujimori, the first South American head of state to visit Bangladesh, an "agent of U.S. imperialism," and criticised the Bangladesh government for inviting him.
Government officials said Hasina and Fujimori would hold formal talks on Sunday aimed at fostering economic relations and trade.
"The trade between the two countries has been negligible," one official said without giving details.
He said the talks would be followed by the signing of two agreements on trade promotion and technical cooperation.
Fujimori, who flew to Dhaka from Vietnam, will go to India from Bangladesh on Sunday.
